original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 322/323 to US dollar, kerb Rs313/316
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee was quoted at 322/323 to the US dollar in the spot market late trade Friday, slightly weaker from Thursday’s close of 320/325 to the greenback.
There were quotes around 317/325, 318/326 in the market in afternoon trade.
Business was done at rates around 215 to 221 in spot and cash markets, during the day, dealers said.
On Thursday spot volumes fell to 33.6 million dollar from an average of around 100 million in previous days. There were 19 million cash deals and 4.3 million tom trades.
The kerb rate was narrower at 313/316 to the US dollar after widening to around 10 rupees as the rupee rose steeply from around 360 to the US dollar.
The central bank said it had collected around 500 million dollars amid a heavy sell-off triggered by the appreciating rupee.
In January the bank bought 211 million dollars on a net basis. (Colombo/Feb11/2023)
